alert.note: Alert for Eastern San Miguel County; Guadalupe County; Quay County (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 15 at 7:45PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN SAN MIGUEL...WEST CENTRAL QUAY AND NORTHEASTERN GUADALUPE COUNTIES THROUGH 815 PM MDT... At 744 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Conchas Dam, or 31 miles southwest of Mosquero, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Conchas Dam, Montoya, Conchas, and Conchas Lake State Park. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between Mile Markers 309 and 316. State Road 104 near Mile Marker 53, and between Mile Markers 61 and 95. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 AM MDT for northeastern and east central New Mexico.

area.areaDesc: Eastern San Miguel County; Guadalupe County; Quay County
